page.title: 16Religions and customs
page.content: Being a country area with few houses, there has been no opportunity for any ethnic group to become established as is the case in nearby Lancaster, and consequently, there are just two places of worship in the block. One Church of England church in Glasson Dock and one Roman Catholic church in Thurnham,close to the Hall. Both are tiny village churches supporting small congregations on Sundays, so there are basically two religions in the block - Protestant and Roman Catholic. A small private chapel is also to be found at Thurnham Hall. This is R.C. The incumbent at Glasson is only part- time, sharing his duties with the Lancaster Royal Infirmary, where he is a chaplain.
